topic.title: Supported upgrade paths
topic.shortdesc: The supplied supported paths apply both to online and offline upgrades.

body.p: There are two basic upgrade paths for the Couchbase Server:

ul.li: Couchbase 2.x to a later version of Couchbase 2.x.

body.p: You must upgrade to the latest available production version before upgrading to Couchbase Server 3.0.x.
For Enterprise Edition customers, that version is Couchbase Server 2.5.2. For Community Edition users, that version is Couchbase Server 2.2.0.
Prior to upgrade, back up the files.

section.title: Upgrading from Community Edition to Enterprise Edition
section.note: Use the same Couchbase Server version number when upgrading to the Enterprise Edition. Version differences can result in a failed upgrade.

section.title: Upgrading to 2.5.x
section.p: If buckets are using any of the following reserved ports, change the port for the bucket. Otherwise, XDCR data encryption won't be available. (This applies both to offline and online upgrades.)

section.note: If Couchbase Server 2.5 has more than two (2) replicas, the first swap rebalance takes additional time. This behavior is expected.

The RPM package manager does not support the --relocate option because it cannot correctly detect which release must be kept and which must be replaced. As result, all binary files and their wrapper scripts cannot be correctly installed into the relocated bin directory during upgrade.
